books.title: The Plastic Age
books.author: Percy Marks
books.summary: A student at an upscale liberal arts college navigates challenges, pitfalls, disillusionment, and the possibilities of his undergraduate experience in Jazz Age New England.

books.title: Tarzan of the Apes
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: An orphan is raised by apes in Africa and goes on various adventures.

books.title: The Autobiography of Mark Twain
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A collection of reminiscences and reflections from the author’s experiences.

books.title: Queen Victoria
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: A sardonic and generally unflattering biography of Victoria Alexandrina, Queen of England.

books.title: Five Children and It
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: Five children encounter an ancient magical creature who grants them wishes—all of which go comically wrong.

books.title: The Way of the World
books.author: William Congreve
books.summary: Two lovers are prevented from marrying due to a previous dalliance.

books.title: Major Barbara
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: The story of idealistic Barbara Undershaft, a Major in the Salvation Army, who does not want to be connected to her father’s “tainted” money.

books.title: Wet Magic
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: A group of children visiting the seaside free a captive mermaid and visit her domain.

books.title: When God Laughs
books.author: Jack London
books.summary: The eleventh collection of short stories by Jack London.

books.title: Brood of the Witch-Queen
books.author: Sax Rohmer
books.summary: A father and son duo investigate a man who is wielding ancient Egyptian magic.

books.title: Red Dusk and the Morrow
books.author: Paul Dukes
books.summary: A newly-minted secret agent is sent to pick up the pieces of Britain’s spy networks after they are shattered by the Red Terror.

books.title: A Study in Scarlet
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: The self-declared world’s first consulting detective unravels a mysterious case of murder and revenge.

books.title: Essays
books.author: Errico Malatesta
books.summary: A collection of essays by Errico Malatesta.

books.title: Two Treatises of Government
books.author: John Locke
books.summary: Locke critiques the concepts of absolute monarchy and divine right, arguing instead for a government founded on natural rights, individual freedom, and the consent of the governed, which protects the fundamental rights of life, liberty, and property.

books.title: Idylls of the King
books.author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson
books.summary: Twelve poems detailing the adventures of Arthur’s round table.

books.title: Northanger Abbey
books.author: Jane Austen
books.summary: A young girl with an overactive imagination comes of age.

books.title: Triplanetary
books.author: E. E. Smith
books.summary: In a universe where all powerful alien races influence the fates of worlds, a war erupts between the Triplanetary League of the inner solar system, pirates led by a mysterious and malicious scientist, and technologically advanced aliens.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: R. A. Lafferty
books.summary: A collection of science fiction and fantasy stories by R. A. Lafferty ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Verses on Various Occasions
books.author: John Henry Newman
books.summary: A collection of poems by John Henry Newman.

books.title: Three Men in a Boat
books.author: Jerome K. Jerome
books.summary: The humorous travelogue of a boating holiday down the Thames taken by three friends and their dog.
